contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2012}} {{about|the 15th-century knight|the Australian rules football player|Ned Sutton}} '''Sir Edmund Sutton''' (1425 – c. 1485) was a [[Knight]] of [[Dudley Castle]] and [[Gatescombe]]. Sutton was born in [[Dudley]], the eldest son of [[John Sutton, 1st Baron Dudley]], [[Order of the Garter|KG]], and his wife Elizabeth, daughter of Sir John Berkeley.<ref name="Burke"/> Edmund married [[John Tiptoft, 1st Baron Tiptoft#Family life|Joyce Tiptoft]], daughter of [[John Tiptoft, 1st Baron Tiptoft]] by Joyce de Cherleton{{sfn|Lee|1920|p=90}} (daughter of [[Edward Charleton, 5th Baron Cherleton]]), ultimately coheir to the baronies of Cherleton and Tiptoft. She transmitted to the Dudley family the quarterings of Tiptoft, Cherleton, Holland, and that of [[Edmund of Woodstock, 1st Earl of Kent|Edmund of Woodstock]], youngest son of King [[Edward I of England]]. Edmund and Joyce's first son was [[Edward Sutton, 2nd Baron Dudley|Edward Sutton]] (b. 1459) who succeeded his grandfather, John Sutton, as [[Baron Dudley|2nd Baron Dudley]].<ref name="Burke">''Burkes Peerage'' (1939 edition), s.v. Dudley, Baron.</ref> They also had another son, Sir John Dudley of Atherington, father of [[Edmund Dudley]] and grandfather of [[John Dudley, Duke of Northumberland]]. Edmund then married Matilda Clifford (c. 1465) and they had multiple children including Thomas Sutton of Yanwath.<ref>http://our-royal-titled-noble-and-commoner-ancestors.com/p462.htm#i13895</ref> Edmund's exact date of death is not known, however, it is documented that he died between 6 July 1483 and the date of his father's death, John Sutton, who died 30 September 1487. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Sutton, Edmund | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = English knight | DATE OF BIRTH = 1425 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sutton, Edmund}} [[Category:1425 births]] [[Category:1480s deaths]] [[Category:Heirs apparent who never acceded]] [[Category:Medieval English knights]]
